channel.title: Npc drops
channel.description:
[code]npcdrop = 1 995 1500000 100[/code]
does that look right cause i did they complied and ran server and i didnt even get a drop? or do i have to have a autospawn him than kill him?

item.title: Npc drops
item.dc:creator: @Deptas1599 Deptas1599
item.description:
@Deptas1599 wrote:

Try at NPCDrops.TSM

#gargoyle 1610:40 995:21500 995:25000 1333:1 1319:1 1147:1 374:150 1163:1 1079:1 1127:1 1093:1 1201:1 2364:5 1373:1 560:100 995:18500

1610-NPC ID (gargoyle)
:40- 40proc drop rate
995:21500- gargoyle drops 21500coins
and ect

item.title: Npc drops
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That… That’s just the constructor. It doesn’t tell me anything about what your server is trying to load. I don’t know if you need 12 tabs between 995 and 1500000 or just 1.

I need the code that loads the file.

And it also looks like you too the NPCHandler class and just renamed it for NPCDrops.
Why I say that:

[code=java]
public class NPCHandler {
public static int maxNPCs = 11256;
public static int maxListedNPCs = 11256;
public static int random;
public static int maxNPCDrops = 11256;
public static NPC npcs[] = new NPC[maxNPCs];

public NPCHandler() {
	for (int i = 0; i < maxNPCs; i++) {
		npcs[i] = null;
	}
	loadAutoSpawn();
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Npc drops
item.dc:creator: @tehgenevoix tehgenevoix
item.description:
@tehgenevoix wrote:

[code]public class NPCDrops {
public int npcId;
public int DropType;
public int[] Items = new int[100];
public int[] ItemsN = new int[100];

public NPCDrops(int _npcId) {
	npcId = _npcId;
	for (int i = 0; i < Items.length; i++) {
		Items[i] = -1;
		ItemsN[i] = 0;
	}
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Npc drops
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

How are we supposed to know what your code should look like?

You need to read the code that loads the file so you understand how it parses the drops.
That way you know what value means what, and how it works.

Can’t give you an answer without knowing what your code is expecting.

Read full topic
